data.text: On October 7, @PaoloMauroEcon and @DaveLawder of @Reuters discuss why credible budgets matter for public finances, based on new analysis in the #FiscalMonitor.  https://t.co/KUkbgldAiM https://t.co/ZBDVsFmQyP

Did you know that the patents for the mRNA vaccines were built on decades of basic scientific research? Our new #WEO looks at the benefits of investing in basic scientific research. https://t.co/K7UnLvVszn #IMFBlog https://t.co/nQbjZZISs0

Resurgent inflation around the world is likely to be temporary, though IMF staff say that there are risks of a pickup. In the latest #IMFBlog, we explore the risk. https://t.co/4PoJCzv14O https://t.co/HCtKY9I3Ra
Resurgent inflation around the world is likely to be temporary, though IMF staff say that there are risks of a pickup. In the latest #IMFBlog, we explore the risk. https://t.co/4PoJCzv14O

Increased funding for basic scientific research and more public-private partnerships in advanced economies could raise long-term growth. Our latest #WEO looks at how. https://t.co/KnxQBjiK2u https://t.co/HA8xDUsUGd
What is the most important change that could be made in the workplace to benefit women? #IMFInspired https://t.co/XEUAWmffwW

Why should countries invest in basic scientific research? 

Our latest World Economic Outlook estimates that a 10% permanent increase in a country’s stock of basic scientific research can increase productivity by 0.3%. https://t.co/KnxQBj19aW #WEO https://t.co/G2zIh5mUMc

Basic scientific research, which is typically undirected, theoretical, or experimental work, is an essential input for innovation. Our latest #WEO looks at the wide-ranging and long-lasting international impact  on productivity. https://t.co/K7UnLvVszn #IMFBlog https://t.co/EKHzxAtwqL
STREAMING NOW: A discussion on how basic research can help boost long-term productivity growth. Watch and read our new #WEO research here: https://t.co/KnxQBj19aW https://t.co/poUdpL9ftP

Headline inflation in advanced economy group is forecast to peak in the coming months, declining to 2% on average in 2022, amidst economic uncertainty. More in our latest #WEO research: https://t.co/b47dDvAuYk https://t.co/GVKRIx7bro
What combination of conditions could cause a persistent spike in inflation? Find out in our latest #IMFBlog: https://t.co/4PoJCzv14O #WEO https://t.co/Xr7NGdhsAi

JUST PUBLISHED: New World Economic Outlook projects headline inflation and inflation expectations over the next few years to revert to pre-pandemic levels in 2022, but there are risks. https://t.co/KnxQBjiK2u https://t.co/8H068qdDTv

.@KGeorgieva: If large parts of the world remain unvaccinated, we could see global GDP losses rise to $5.3 trillion over the next five years—and the human tragedy will continue. We must fight the ‘Great Vaccination Divide’! Learn what policies can help: https://t.co/oubxzyedM5 https://t.co/TiJEnSSyTD

At the #T20Summit, with @ispionline and @Unibocconi, @KGeorgieva called on countries to make the most of the $650bn in SDRs. Better-off countries should voluntarily channel their SDRs to ensure that more go to countries most in need. See her full remarks: https://t.co/oubxzyedM5 https://t.co/rMTZLFTteM

Tune in tomorrow, October 6, at 11:00 AM ET as IMF’s Philip Barrett and @YahooFinance’s @bcheungz discuss how basic research is helping fight the pandemic and can contribute to long-term growth. https://t.co/pim2kaFxQn #WEO https://t.co/poUdpKRE5f

ICYMI: @KGeorgieva delivered her curtain raiser speech ahead of the 2021 Annual Meetings and had a discussion with @SenatoreMonti of Bocconi University and @paolo_magri of @ispionline. https://t.co/NJQWjxN9H4

At the #T20Summit, with @ispionline and @Unibocconi, @KGeorgieva highlighted three “stones” in our shoes: economic divergence, inflation, and debt—these are affecting especially emerging and developing countries. See her full remarks – https://t.co/oubxzxWCUx https://t.co/Rh8sKk9dBN

.@KGeorgieva said the global recovery remains “hobbled” by the pandemic. We are unable to walk forward properly—it’s like walking with stones in our shoes! See full remarks at the #T20Summit with @ispionline and @Unibocconi.  – https://t.co/oubxzxWCUx https://t.co/gkdLnvtPVz

.@KGeorgieva said the IMF expects global growth to moderate slightly this year, while risks and obstacles to recovery have become more pronounced. Speaking at the #T20Summit with @ispionline and @Unibocconi.  Remarks ahead of the 2021 Annual Meetings here: https://t.co/oubxzyedM5 https://t.co/8A4xHi6WBj
